Ella vende en el mercado de Masaya desde hace 7años y ha tenido su negocio por 16.  El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, cacao, frutas frescas, trigo etc.
texts.en:
Pascuala is a entrepreneur from Masaya who has been working with the institution for 11 years. She is 61 years old, married, and has three adult children. 

She and her husband earn a living from their business selling fruits, pinol (flour made from toasted maize), and pinolillo (a drink made of corn meal and cocoa) at the market in Masaya. They have been selling in the Masaya market for 7 years and have owned their business for 16. She will use the loan to buy corn, cocoa, fresh fruits, and wheat etc.

loans.use: to buy corn, cocoa, fruits, and grains to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy furniture, hair dryers, an electricity generator, makeup and cosmetics.

loans.name: Doaa

texts.en:
Doaa is a 22-year-old woman from Gaza. Since 2009, she has owned a shop for renting wedding gowns and evening dresses.

Doaa asked Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy dresses and window display dolls. She hopes that this loan will help her improve her income and thus continue her higher education.

loans.use: to buy dresses and window display dolls for the dresses in her shop.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 16 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past five years, Alice has been working hard to manage her vegetable kiosk, which sells tomatoes, fish, and onions. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more tomatoes, fish, and onions for sale. This will help Alice to generate greater profits and expand her business. Alice hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more tomatoes, fish, and onions for sale.

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina de 22 años es una madre soltera de mucha responsabilidad, tiene como un gran motivo de vida a su pequeña Ángela de 2 años para quien dedica todo su esfuerzo, por momento habita en una vivienda de adobe en calidad de alquiler.
Al hallarse sin empleo, decidió desde hace 3 años sumergirse en el mundo del negocio, dando todo de si , es así como con ayuda de su entidad financiera logró aperturar un negocio dedicado a la venta de prendas de vestir en un local que viene ocupando en calidad de alquiler.
Optó por este negocio debido a que lo considera mas limpio, tranquilo y ordenado sin contar que posee un buen gusto  en la elección de prendas de vestir para sus clientas, pues también posee una buena variedad en prendas de vestir para bebes debido a tiene mas salida en su venta.
Al aproximarse el fin de año desea contar con una amplia variedad de prendas de vestir para damas y niños así como prendas de temporada para fin de año.
Espera desempeñarse con la misma motivación que la caracteriza para cumplir uno de sus objetivos que es el de aperturar una tienda de ropa muy grande en su localidad y sabe que es posible lograrlo si sigue inyectando gotas de esfuerzo y trabajo constante. Todo con el objetivo de brindarle a su pequeño una vida mejor y darle cosas que ella no tuvo de niña. Con los 3,500 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará mercadería para su negocio consistente en prendas de vestir para niños y damas para la temporada de fin de año.
texts.en:
Karina is 22 years old and a single mother with lots of responsibility.  Her two year old daughter, Angela is her great motivation and she dedicates all her effort for her.  She currently lives in a rented adobe house.

Having found herself unemployed three years ago, she decided to go into business, giving her all, and this is how she helps herself financially.  She sells clothing in a shop that she rents.

She opted for this business because she considers it to be cleaner, calmer, more organized, and because she has good taste in clothing for her customers.  She also has a good variety of clothing for babies.

As the end of the year approaches, she wants to expand her variety of clothing for women and children, and include seasonal clothing.

She expects to have the same motivation that allows her to complete her goals to have large clothing store in her area.  She knows that it’s possible to do it if she continues making a constant effort.  It’s all so that she can provide her young daughter a better life and give her the things that she didn’t have as a child.  She will use the 3,500 PEN to buy merchandise for her business; seasonal women and children’s clothing.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en:
Kalsoom is a 35-year-old married woman. She is the mother of four children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. 

Kalsoom has been in the business of gloves-making for the past eight years. Her husband works for low income on a power loom, so Kalsoom is contentedly in business for the sake of her family. She also sews clothes as a part time job. In this way, she is able to effectively handle her family's needs and requirements. 

Recently, Kalsoom contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of 13000 PKR to purchase raw materials, such as bundles of cloth for the winter season, to inflate her sales. She desires to spend part of her profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, such as bundles of cloth for the winter season, to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en:
Hrant is 23 years old and was born in one of Vanadzor’s villages. He is a student at Yerevan State Pedagogical University in the sport department. Hrant's parents are jobless and unable to pay for his education. This is Hrant's primary motivation for going into business. For almost a year, Hrant has run a successful business. After he finishes his education, he wants to combine his business activity with his main specialty in sport.

Hrant smokes and sells fish to earn a living. He is taking his first steps in business, and he wants to combine his enterprise with studying. Hrant processes fish in the cellar of his own house in Stepanavan City. He buys fresh fish from Vanadzor’s wholesale markets and sells the finished product in Stepanavan's food shops and markets. He already has a lot of clients in Stepanavan City and some smoked fish demand from Vanadzor City. That's why he decided to increase his smoked fish production.

Hrant asks for 400,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to increase his smoked fish production. He hopes to earn a good profit during the big Christmas holiday sales season.

loans.use: to purchase fish for smoking and selling.

loans.name: Mt Udzungwa Group

texts.en:
Shida, who is in her late 20s, is married and lives with her husband and her two children, both of whom are in school. For three years, Shida has been earning a living by running a retail shop selling a variety of products. She works from 6 am to 10 pm every day, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Shida's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to cover household expenses and purchase needed shop items. She has paid back all her loans successfully. 

Shida is requesting a new loan, which she wants to use to buy more shop inventory. Her dream is to one day be able to expand her business into different areas.

Shida will share this loan with her loan group, "Mt Udzungwa," which totals 11 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Magdalene

texts.en:
Magdalene is a 45-year-old business lady who is divorced with four children. For the past ten years, her primary business has been mixed-crop farming, and selling second hand clothes has been her secondary business. She earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Magdalene is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the program by a KADET staff member. Magdalene will use the loan to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more stock of clothes. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her clothing business and to export her farm produce.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer, and more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Cissy

texts.en:
Cissy's group is made up of hard working women. Cissy is 22 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past 3 years, Cissy has been working hard to manage her farming business, which deals in maize and beans. 

To help expand her business, Cissy has requested a loan of 450000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to get a watering can for her farming business, and will help Cissy to generate greater profits and expand in farming. Cissy hopes that in the future she will be able to widen the farm for other produce. 

Cissy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to get a watering can for her farming business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth, de 29 años es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de Aldo, su esposo desde hace 8 años. En todo este tiempo criaron de su pequeña hija, Fiorela. A la que cuidan en su casa propia. Su principal ingreso económico, constan de la siembra de papa, zanahoria, maíz y habas, las cuales cultiva en sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Cuenta que en cada cosecha los comercializa en la capital del país, donde obtiene un mejor ingreso económico, pues el precio de demanda es mayor. En ocasiones, cuando lava la zanahoria en el río, los mismos compradores recogen sus cosechas para comercializarlos. Ya que se ven ricas y sobre todo saludables. Pero su otro ingreso económico se centra en la crianza de vacas, posee 6; las cuales le brindan la leche necesaria para elaborar yogurt natural, a la semana realiza un promedio de 100 litros. Cuenta que su secreto está en la mantención de los animales, pues los nutre, alimenta con comida balanceada, además de ofrecerles una asistencia técnica una vez al mes. “Tengo que cuidarlos para obtener buenos resultados”, comenta. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, y se siente feliz, pues encontró la ayuda que tanto necesitaba, para emprender sus objetivos. Además es responsable en todas sus labores, por ello promete ser puntual en los pagos.
Elizabeth, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra abono orgánico para esparcir entre sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, 29, is a hardworking woman.  She lives with Aldo, her husband of eight years.  During this time they raised their little girl, Fiorela, in their own home.

Her main income comes from growing potatoes, carrots, corn, and beans in her own fields.  She says she sells every harvest in the capital of the country, where she gets better income because the demand price is greater.  Sometimes, when she's washing the carrots in the river, the buyers themselves pick her crops to sell them because they look delicious and healthy.

Her other income comes from raising cows.  She has six that give enough milk to make natural yogurt, an average of 100 liters per week.  She says her secret is taking care of the animals: she nourishes them with balanced feed and they have a visit from a specialist once a month.  "I have to take care of them to get good results," she says.

This is her third loan with MFP and she's happy because she found the help she needed so much to achieve her goals.  In addition, she's responsible in all her jobs, so she's committed to making her payments punctually.

Elizabeth will invest the requested money in buying organic fertilizer for her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara's group is made up of hard working women. Barbara  is 20 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Barbara has been working hard to manage her vegetable stall, which sells matooke (similar to plantains) and greens. 

To help expand her business, Barbara has requested a loan of 400000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more vegetables to sell and will help Barbara generate greater profits and expand the business. Barbara  hopes that in the future she will be able to add to the business. 

Barbara is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gloria Elizabeth

texts.es: Gloria  inicio su negocio de Costura  hace 7 años y el negocio ha  marchado  muy bien, ella esta solicitando el crédito  para   Comprar una  Máquina Sobrehiladora   que le ayudará a terminar más rápido  sus trabajos de Costura  y de bordados  y asi  poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, satisfacer sus requerimientos y poder incrementar el número de ellos, además este negocio le ha permitido hacer lo que más le gusta lo cual es dedicarse a la Costura;  agradecerá la ayuda que se pueda brindar.
texts.en:
Gloria started her sewing business seven years ago and it has gone very well for her.

She's requesting a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine (serger), which will help her finish her garments and embroidery faster, give her customers better service, fulfill her orders, and increase the number of orders.  In addition, this business has allowed her to do what she most likes, which is sew.

She'll be grateful for the help given to her.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise and supplies.

loans.name: Maricela

texts.es:
La señorita Maricela es originaria de la ciudad de San Luis Potosí desde muy pequeña sus padres se vivieron a radicar a la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo, para poder darles una vida mejor a ella y a sus hermanas.
La señorita Maricela se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades son figuras para las fiestas como piñatas, bautizos, bodas y graduaciones. Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en material ya que le están tiene barios pedidos para entregar de figuras navideñas, pero no tiene el suficiente material para terminar a tiempo, es por eso que esta solicitando el crédito y así poder comprar todo lo que necesita poder terminar a tiempo para la entrega  y que dar bien con sus clientes para que la recomienda con otras persona.
La señorita Maricela vive con su papa que es una persona mayor y necesita atención es quien lo cuida.
Desea mejorar su negocio y tener mayor ingreso a la familia.
texts.en: Maricela is originally from the city of San Luis Potosí but her parents moved to the city of Nuevo Laredo when she was still a little girl to give her and her sisters a better life.  Maricela works making crafts that are figures for parties like birthdays, baptisms, weddings and graduations.  She’s requesting a loan to buy supplies because she has several pending orders to fill for Christmas figures but does not have enough supplies to finish on time and this is why she’s asking for the loan so she can buy everything she needs to finish and deliver on time so that her customers will be happy and will recommend her to others.  Maricela lives with her father who is a senior citizen and needs care; she’s who takes care of him.  She wants to improve her business and earn higher family income.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Seydi Xiomara

texts.es:
La  Joven Seydi de 27 años  es soltera vive en casa de su madre junto con sus hermanos menores, radica en la comunidad de  Nacaome, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 13 años al negocio de venta de golosinas y comida corriente, en su negocio ubicado en el local de su casa, sus clientes son los vecinos y amigos que a diario le visitan, le prefieren por su amabilidad, buen trato y variedad de golosinas, buen ambiente.  Seydi se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y con deseos de salir adelante.
Ella está solicitando 15,000.00 lempiras para compra de frescos, verduras, pollo y mínimo verde. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella pretende suplir la necesidad de financiamiento para su negocio y  de igual forma mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar más su negocio  y tener su propia casa
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2012.
texts.en:
Seydi, 27, is a young, single woman living in her mother’s house with her younger siblings.  She lives in the community of Nacaome in south Honduras.  She’s been selling snacks and fast-food for 13 years; her food stand is located at home.  Her customers are neighbors who come by daily and prefer her because of her kindness, good service, variety of snacks and good environment.  Seydi is noted for being an enterprising woman who very much wants to get ahead.

She’s asking for a 15,000 Lempira loan to buy bananas, vegetables, chicken and plantain.  With support from this loan she intends to meet her business’ financing need while improving her income in the same way.  Her dream is to improve the business still more and to own a house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October, 2012.

loans.use: to buy bananas, plantain and chicken.

loans.name: Tawa

texts.en: Tawa is 48, single, and a mother of four children that are between the ages of 3 and 21. All her children live at home and are in school. For the past six years she has been working hard to manage her business in order to afford her children's educational expenses. She lives in West Point Community. She sells nails, hammers, door locks, hinges and paint brushes. She works twelve hours a day and transports her goods by taxi. She makes profits when she sells, and uses those profits to buy more goods to improve the business. She has requested a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, nails, and hammers for the business.Her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, nails, hinges, and hammers to increase her  sales.

loans.name: Kyenzige Sacco Group

texts.en:
Gertrude is divorced from her husband and has four children; three of them attend school and one has not yet started schooling. She is a farmer, selling charcoal and produce (beans, maize, and millet), which she started doing in 2011 in order to supplement her salary from teaching to be able to look after the family. She is hard working and honest. Gertrude operates this business in the outskirts of Kagadi and her major clients are residents of the area. 

She has requested a loan of 200,000 shillings to add into her business of selling beans and maize in order to meet increasing demand and get more income to cater to her family's needs.

Her dream is provide the children with a higher level of education using the proceeds from the business and to buy more land and construct a house for the children. Her major challenge is the limited capital to use in the business and she hopes that if she is financed her challenge will gradually become a thing of the past.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce (beans, maize, etc.)

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 57 años radica en la ciudad de Ayacucho, comparte un matrimonio ejemplar junto a Papiasabilio de 59 años, ambos tienen solo una hija Karina quien ya mayor se encuentra desempeñando estudios superiores fuera de su ciudad. Luego de haber cumplido un ciclo intensivo a lo largo de su vida en el campo junto a su esposo, decidieron que ya era hora de soltar riendas a una actividad económica distinta consistente en su tienda de abarrotes. Tiene el firme apoyo de su esposo, con quien comparte los distintos roles que requiere esta abnegada actividad logrando convertirla en un buen sustento para su economía familiar. Resulta rentable a fin de cuentas debido a que la ubicación de su negocio se halla cerca de la plaza principal de su comunidad abarcando a gran parte de las ventas.
Ya que estamos a puertas de ingresar a las fiestas de fin de año los comercios en general de su localidad presentan un crecimiento en las ventas mensuales es por ello que desea contar con capital para la compra de diversos productos al por mayor como panteones, chocolates y otros víveres en general como sacos de arroz y azúcar.
A futuro desea seguir trabajando con el mismo entusiasmo para adquirir una parcela adicional de cultivo para dejarla en calidad de alquiler a otros productores ya que el terreno de la zona es muy fértil en cuanto a productos agropecuarios. Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita, comprará panetones, chocolates y demás vivieres de primera necesidad para la campaña de fin de año.
texts.en:
Nancy, 57, lives in the city of Ayacucho. She is happily married to Papiasabilio, 59. They have just one daughter, Karina, who, now an adult, is undertaking higher education away from the city. After having worked hard throughout her life in the countryside, together with her husband, they decided that it was time to take up a different economic activity, consisting of their grocery store. She has the steady support of her husband, with whom she shares this demanding activity, managing to convert it into a good means of support for her family finances. It works out as profitable, as the location of her business is near the main square of her community, accounting for a large part of the sales. 

As we are now about to enter in to the end of year celebrations, businesses in her area generally show a growth in monthly sales. It is because of this that she wishes to have capital to buy different products wholesale, like panetones, chocolates and other general groceries like bags of rice and sugar. 

In the future she wishes to continue working with the same enthusiasm, to acquire an additional plot of land to let to other producers as the land in the area is very fertile for agriculture. With the 1000 PEN that she is applying for, she will buy panetones, chocolates and other staple groceries for the end of year season.

loans.use: to buy panetones, chocolates and other staple groceries for the end of year season.

loans.name: Neli

texts.en: Neli is a 66-year-old woman. She lives in a small village of the Kaspi district with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and a grandchild. Neli’s husband works as a watchman locally and gets a monthly salary. The whole family is involved in agricultural business. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products. Neli sells the dairy at the local open market. All members of the family work hard to improve their living conditions. Neli requested a loan to repair her house. She wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Neli and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zirobwe in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 3 years, Peninah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which puts up sugar, rice and salt up for sale. 

To help expand her business, Peninah has requested a loan of 450000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more rice, sugar, and salt for sale, and will help Peninah to generate greater profits and enlarge the business. Peninah hopes that in the future she will be able to start another retail business. 

Peninah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and salt to sell.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El señor Alfredo ya ha tenido tres créditos con KIVA el cual a pagado puntualmente y han sido para inversión en su negocio.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para invertir en comprar de mercancía ya que le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de productos y sus clientes le están solicitando esta variedad.
El señor Alfredo es originario del Estado de Coahuila  y tiene ya mas de 50 años radicando en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo. Y 10 años dedicándose a las ventas de abarrotes, entre su esposa y el señor Alfredo son los que atiende el negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ellos. Es por eso que esta solicitando el préstamo e invertir en su negocio, con las ganancias que obtiene será para pagar el crédito ya que sus hijos le ayudan económicamente y con ese ingreso es para los gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Alfredo has had three loans with Kiva already.  They have been to invest in his business and he has repaid them punctually.  He's requesting a loan to buy merchandise because he needs a greater variety of products, which his customers are ordering.

Alfredo is from the state of Coahuila but has lived in the city of Nuevo Laredo for more than 50 years.  He has made a living in grocery sales for 10 years.  He and his wife tend the store because it's his source of income for them.  This is why he's requesting the loan and investing in his business.  With the profits he'll pay back the loan, because his children help him financially and that income is for the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his grocery store

loans.name: Gs El Shadai Group

texts.es:
La Señora Mariana es  comerciante se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería cuenta con 4 años de experiencia, sus ventas las realiza en su casa de habitación y también a domicilio, una de las  características de Doña Mariana es su amabilidad y el buen trato al cliente, lo que le ha permitido ser un apoyo para su esposo en el sostenimiento de su familia.
El préstamo que esta solicitando Doña Mariana espera surtir mas su negocio con perfumes, cosméticos, cremas y otros articulos de uso personal para aumentar sus ganancias captar nuevos clientes  aprovechando tambien  la temporada de corta de café, Ella cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo en el desarrollo de su trabajo para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Doña Mariana su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida.
Doña Mariana el préstamo que esta solicitando es de manera grupal integrada por las siguientes personas.
Ana su fuente principal de ingresos es la venta de ropa usada, zapatos de mujer y varón sandalias de baño accesorios de belleza desde hace 9 años.
Santos quien se dedica a la elaboración de estructuras metálicas como  ser: puertas, portones corredizos, roperos, libreros etc. Actividad que desempeña desde hace 13 años.
En la Fotografia los integrantes del Grupo el Shadai aparecen en el negocio de la Señora Ana quien tiene una tienda donde vende Ropa de segunda mano.
Danlí El Paraíso, Honduras - Octubre 2012
texts.en:
Mariana is a merchant who has been selling cosmetics and perfumes for 4 years. She sells her products from home as well as door to door; this has allowed her to help her husband support their family. Mariana is kind and treats her clients well.
The loan Mariana is requesting is to supply her business with perfumes, cosmetics, creams and other items for personal use, so that she can increase her earnings and gain new clients, taking advantage of coffee harvesting season. Her husband supports her in her plans to grow her business to improve their family's quality of life. Mariana's dream is to improve her quality of life. 
The loan Mariana is requesting is as part of a group, which consists of the following people : Ana, whose main source of income is the sale of second hand clothing, women's and men's shoes, plastic sandals, beauty accessories. Ana has been in business for 9 years. And Santos, who makes metallic structures such as : doors, closets, shelving, etc. Santos has been in business for 13 years. 
The participants of the Shadai Group are pictured in the business of Ana, who owns a used clothing store.  

Danli el Paraiso, Honduras - October 2012.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, creams and other items for her business

loans.name: Carthine

texts.en: Carthine is 35, single and a mother of three children between the ages of 6 and 20. All of her children live at home and attend school. Carthine is hard working; she works twelve hours a day in order to attend to her children's needs. She lives in the West Point community. She is proud of her business because of the increase in her sales, and she feels independent. She started this business with a little amount that she saved with a saving club. Carthine transports her goods by taxi. She has requested this loan to purchase more door locks, nails, hinges, and hammers for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, nails, hinges, and hammers for the business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 17 years old and lives in the town of Zirobwe in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past two years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells coffee. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 550,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a weighing scale for coffee, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and buy a piece of land. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to get a bigger piece of land to grow more coffee. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a weighing scale for coffee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 21 years old and lives in the town of Zirobwe in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children. For the past 3 years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy other varieties of drinks such as lemonade, and will help Immaculate generate greater profits and make the business bigger. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a piece of land. 

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy various drinks such as lemonade

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth, 35, lives in the West Point community with her husband and four children who are between the ages of three months and 16 years old. Ruth's husband is an instructor; he gave her the initial capital to start in this business. 

Ruth learned to sell from her friends. She has her business near her house where she sells fourteen hours per day. She sells rice, palm oil, cooking oil, tomatoes, salt, and coal by retail. She transports her goods by taxi. 

Ruth is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, palm oil, salt, vita, and tomatoes to increase her sales. Her plans are to educate her children and to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, salt, vita, tomatoes to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a new premises for her cafe

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional stock of secondhand clothes

loans.name: Zeneyda

texts.es:
Zeneyda es habitante de la comunidad la Thompson,  ubicada en la parte norte de Estelí, su estado civil es unión de hecho estable y tiene un hijo a su cargo en edad escolar. 

Zeneyda junto a su compañero de vida, se dedican desde hace cuatro años al comercio (pulpería) esta iniciativa de negocio surgió con ahorro propio de la pareja.

EL negocio consiste en una pulpería y sus principales clientes son habitantes de la misma comunidad, los que en su mayoría trabajan en diferentes empresas privadas 
 
Con las utilidades del negocio lo destina para aumentar su inventario y cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar y darle mejor condición de vida para su familia.

la joven emprendedora solicita un crédito  a ceprodel para compra de granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz y producto perecederos). así aumentar el  inventario de su negocio  el aumento de sus ganancia al ampliar su oferta y a si la captación de mayor número de clientes.
texts.en:
Zeneyda lives in the Thompson community located in the northern part of Estelí. She is in a stable common law marriage and has a school age son under her care.

Zeneyda along with her life partner have worked for some four years in their business (a small grocery store), that they started with their own savings.

The business is a small grocery store and its main customers are people who live around the neighborhood, most of whom work for different private companies.

The earnings from the business are used to increase inventory and cover basic household needs and to improve the quality of life of her family.

The young entrepreneur needs a loan from ceprodel to buy basic grains (rice, beans, corn and perishable goods) to increase the businesses’ inventory and to increase profits by offering more products and get the attention of a greater number of customers.

loans.use: buy basic grains like rice, beans and corn, and perishable goods.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To add new stock of potatoes, fat etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Rosa Amelia de 49 anos de edad, casada sin hijos, departamento de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en la zona de occidente del  país. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería y taller de tortillas. Tiene 26 anos de tener el negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación. El negocio lo inicio con un poco de ahorros propios y para tener una fuente de trabajo digna, y ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Rosa ya ha trabajado con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El objetivo del préstamo es para  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con la compra de materia prima para elaborar sus tortillas como maíz, cal, leña, bolsas plásticas. Rosa agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Rosa Amelia is 49 years old. She is married but does not have any children. She lives in the department of Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. She runs her own business, which consists of a small grocery store and tortilla-making workshop, which she has run from her home for 26 years. She started the business with her own small savings in order to have a decent source of work and to help with the household expenses. 

Rosa has already worked with Fundación and has shown responsibility in paying on time and in form. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and to stock her business by buying the materials to prepare her tortillas, such as corn, lime, firewood and plastic bags. Rosa is thankful for the help Kiva lenders provide to low income families and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they too can have decent work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy materials to prepare tortillas, such as corn, firewood, lime, and plastic bags.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio tiene 30 años de edad, es casado, y  vive con su hija y su esposa actualmente, el con el crédito desea comprar ganado. Este caballero, el cual es caracterizado por ser un hombre trabajador,  y muy humilde, quiere  generar ingresos  a su familia, para salir adelante y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida por medio de esta actividad económica, pero su situación económica no le permite realizar dicha compra, ya que no cuenta con el capital necesario y no tiene manera alguna de cómo adquirirlo, por lo que hace  solicitud de un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Mauricio, 30, is married living with his daughter and wife.  He wants to use the loan to buy cattle.  This gentleman who is noted for being a hardworking, very humble man, wants to earn family income to get ahead and be able to have a better quality of life by means of this economic activity but his economic situation does not permit this purchase because he lacks the necessary capital and has no way to get it which is why he’s making this loan request, his first from Fudecosur.  He’s had no previous loans in state banks and Fudecosur offered the best terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Yorleny

texts.es: Yorleni, quien tiene 33 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos, y vive con su familia actualmente, solicito un crédito, con el cual pretende comprar productos medicinales para ganado, puesto que su familia depende de esta actividad económica, y ella no cuenta con el dinero necesario para continuar dándole asistencia a estos animales, ya que estos productos tienen un elevado costo y sin ellos, los animales podrían sufrir serias consecuencias como, enfermedades, por lo tanto el préstamo no solo la favorece a ella, sino también a sus animales ya que ellos reciben un mejor mantenimiento y así se encontraran en mejores condiciones y serán de mejor calidad y factibles a la hora de comercializarlos . Por lo que ella hace una solicitud de crédito, y es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Yorleni is 33 years old. She is married, has two children and currently lives with her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine for livestock as her family relies on this economic activity. She does not have enough money to continue to help these animals as the medicine is costly; without the medicine, the animals might suffer serious consequences such as illness. Thus, the loan is not helping her alone, it will also help her animals as they will get better care; as a result, they will be in better shape, of higher quality and viable when time comes to commercialize them. This is why she is asking for a loan and it is the first loan she has been offered by FUDECOSUR. She has no other loans with national banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered her this loan with better terms and at a very reduced interest rate.

loans.use: To purchase livestock and medicine for her livestock

loans.name: Victor Rodrigo

texts.es:
Víctor  es un hombre agricultor de 32  años de edad, el esta casado y vive en Sololá.  El tiene cinco hijos de ellos cuatro varones  y una mujer. Cuatro de ellos estudian en una escuela de la comunidad y lo apoyan en el campo  en tiempos libres.
El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando cebolla, cebollines, hierbabuena,  en parcelas que tiene  a pocos metros de su vivienda, esto lo aprendió de su padre ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar en alguna escuela de su comunidad  y eso fue su primer trabajo .
El ahora cuenta con siete años de realizar su propio cultivo viendo que obtiene ganancias buenas, cultivando estas verduras y legumbres de este modo el solicita un préstamo de   Q 6,000.00 para que pueda comprar semillas de cebolla  y su fertilizante para luego cultivarlo y cosecharlo mejorando sus ingresos y condiciones de vida junto a su familia expandiendo su cultivo.
El sueña con tener una parcela lo suficiente para que pueda compartirlo con sus hijos y que ellos puedan en un futuro construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Víctor, 32, is a farmer. He is married and lives in Solalá. He has five children, four sons and one daughter. Four of his children study at a local school and help him in the fields during their free time. He works in agriculture, cultivating onions, green onions, and mint in plots that are a few meters from his home. He learned this trade from his father, because he did not have the opportunity to study in the local school. Farming was his first job.

He has been working his own harvest for seven years. He has earned good money growing these vegetables and legumes this way. He is applying for a loan of Q 6,000.00 so that he can buy onion seeds and fertilizer, to later cultivate and harvest. He will increase his income and improve his quality of life along with that of his family. He will expand his crop. His dream is to have a plot big enough to be able to share it with his children, and that they can, in the future, build their own homes.

loans.use: to buy onion seeds and fertilizer for his crop.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is a 42-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. He has been offering transport services with his lorry for the past two years. He uses his monthly income of 20,000 Kenyan shillings to support his family. 

Dominic is applying for his first loan term with KADET Ltd after being introduced by a staff member. Dominic will use the loan to open a retail shop. With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a car and a piece of land.

loans.use: to open a retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Granito De Arena Group

texts.es: Félix tiene 34 años de edad es originaria de una comunidad llamada Macho de Agua donde se encuentran las oficinas de Vision Mundial, donde apoyan más que nada a los niños de bajos recursos, ella desde hace 4 años trabaja con VisionFund para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio y con las ganancias las condiciones de vida de sus hijos, dice que uno de sus hijos es patrocinado y eso le gusta por que ha recibido apoyo y ayuda por parte de Visión Mundial. Dice que ella estudió hasta segundo año de secundaria porque sus padres no pudieron seguir apoyándola puesto que tiene más hermanos y los recursos no eran suficientes para seguir ayudándola a estudiar. Ella pertenece a un grupo llamado Granito de Arena y dice que le pusieron ese nombre al grupo porque un negocio se va haciendo de poco en poquito de granito en granito como dice ella. Félix se dedica a la compra y venta de borregos desde hace mas de 5 años y en temporada decembrina se dedica a la venta de ropa como son pants, playeras, chamarras, gorros, guantes y bufandas para dama, caballero y niños desde hace dos años, también se dedica en tiempo de lluvias a la siembra de maíz y de trigo con lo cual les dará de comer a sus animalitos. Dice que su ropa que vende la va a surtir a la Ciudad de México donde le dan mejores precios y así ella le puede ganar algo a la hora de venderla, dice que vende su ropa en su localidad y con gente que ella conoce aledaña a su comunidad ya que les da la ropa en pagos y cada quincena les va cobrando poco a poco. Ella está muy contenta con su negocio porque dice que le va bien cuando es temporada de frío porque sí vende casi toda la ropa que surte, ahorita esta pidiendo un crédito para comprar mas variedad de ropa abrigadora y también quiere empezar a vender botas de felpa para el invierno que son económicas y que ya vio en México para surtirlas. Félix quiere seguir con el negocio todo el año y que sus clientas ya le han dicho que siga vendiendo ya que tiene buen gusto para escoger la ropa. Ella está casada con el señor Fernando el cual es chofer de servicio público, ellos tienen tres hijos de nombres Estefany estudiante de preparatoria, Fernanda la cual estudia la secundaria y es patrocinada por Visión Mundial y la pequeña Emili la cual tiene 3 años de edad. El crédito le beneficiara porque así ella podrá tener una fuente de ingreso para darles a sus pequeñas hijas una mejor calidad de vida. Los otros cuatro compañeros de grupo se llaman María de Lourdes, Sonia, Eduardo y Marisol ellos invertirán en sus negocios de compra venta de frutas y legumbres de temporada, en la compra de graba, arena, piedra para vender para hacer construcciones, en la compra de material para hacer bordados artesanales y después venderlos, en el mantenimiento de una combi de servicio público.
texts.en:
Félix is 34 years old and is from a community called Macho de Agua where World Vision's offices are located, which supports children with few resources more than anything else. She has worked with VisionFund for four years to improve her business' condition and with her earnings, has improved her children's lives. She says that one of her children is sponsored and she likes that because she has received support and help on the part of World Vision. She says that she studied up to her second year of secondary school because her parents could not continue supporting her because she has many siblings and they did not have enough to continue supporting her studies. 

She belongs to a group called Granito de Arena and says that they named it that because a business grows little by little from one grain of sand to the next. Félix makes a living buying and selling lambs and has done so for more than five years. During December for the past two years she has been selling clothing including pants, t-shirts, ponchos, hats, gloves, and scarves for women, men and children. During the rainy season she also grows corn and wheat, which she feeds to her animals. She says that she is going to buy the clothing in Mexico City where they give the best prices and will be able to make a profit when she makes her sales. She says that she sells her clothing in her neighborhood and to people she knows around her community since she sells her clothing to them in installments and every 15 days she collects the money little by little. She is very happy with her business. She says that it is going well for her because during the cold weather she sells the clothing that she stocks up on. She is now requesting a loan to buy a greater variety of cold weather clothing and also whats to begin selling plush boots for the winter because they are inexpensive and has seen them in stock in Mexico City. Féliz wants to continue with her business all year since her customers have told her to continue selling because she knows how to pick out clothing. 

She is married to Fernando who is a public transportation driver. They have three children--Estefany is in preparatory school, Fernanda is in high school and sponsored by World Vision and little Emili who is 3 years old. The loan will benefit her because she will be able to have an income source to give her children a better quality life. The other four members of the group are María de Lourdes, Sonia, Eduardo and Marisol. They will invest in businesses selling in-season fruits and vegetables, gravel, sand and stone to sell as building supplies, in the purchase of material to make artisan weaves to then sell and in the maintenance of assorted public services.

loans.use: to buy clothing including pants, t-shirts, ponchos, hats, gloves and scarves for women, men and children.

loans.name: Sol Group

texts.es: Doña Argemira tiene 57 años de edad y es viuda; ella es originaria de una población llamada Zitácuaro un lugar lleno de historia y donde muy cerca se encuentran lugares turísticos donde la gente puede divertirse y pasarla muy tranquilamente. Arge, como le gusta que le digan, es parte del grupo Sol dice que su nuera fue quien la invitó a formar parte del grupo para que surtiera mejor su puestecito de dulces. Platica que a raíz de que su marido falleció ella se ha hecho cargo de sus gastos de su casa y aunque vive sola ella tiene que pagar servicios como agua, luz, gas, etc. Platica que tiene 4 hijos pero ya todos son casados ella dice “mis hijos a veces me ayudan porque también tienen sus familias que mantener aunque es poco con lo que me ayudan pero si me sirve de algo para comprar mis medicamentos y para pagar los servicios de la casa”. Comenta que desde hace más de un año puso su puestecito de dulces fuera de su casa ya que cerca se encuentran un bachillerato, un kinder y una secundaria y los muchachos de las escuelas son sus clientes ya que también vende refrescos y juguitos para poder ayudarse y para sentirse útil ya que ella no puede salir a buscar un trabajo porque es débil visual y no puede andar sola por la calle, dice que quien le ayuda mucho es una de sus nueras ya que ella le ayuda a surtir sus dulces en tiendas de su población donde encuentra precios bajos y ella le pueda ganar algo. Platica que este es su segundo ciclo con el cual trabaja para VisionFund y que le ha ido muy bien porque no siente pesado los pagos ya que de las ganancias que saca de la venta de dulces puede pagar el crédito y seguir surtiendo, ahorita ella está pidiendo otro crédito porque surtirá dulces de diferentes variedades, sabores y refrescos. La meta es ampliar su negocio y que para el año que entra quiere vender lapiceros, colores, libretas de diferentes tamaños, gomas, sacapuntas para así mejorar su calidad de vida. Las otras integrantes del grupo se llaman Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Argelia, Susana, Karen Alejandra, Karen Alejandra y Estela ellas invertirán en la compra de material para surtir papelería, en la compra de ingredientes para elaboración de pomadas naturistas para vender, para surtir ropa interior para dama, también para surtir ropa para damas, caballeros y niños para vender, en la compra de material para invertirlo en un cibercafé, se invertirá en la compra de refresco por mayoreo para surtir deposito y vender al mayoreo.
texts.en:
Argemira is 57 years of age and a widow.  She is from Zitácuaro, a town full of history, which lies close to tourist destinations where people go to enjoy themselves or relax.  Arge, as she likes to be called, belongs to the Sol (Sun) group.  She says that it was her daughter-in-law who invited her to join the group as a means of obtaining better stock for her sweet stall.  She says that since her husband died she has been responsible for the household expenses and, although she lives alone, she has to pay for services such as water, electricity and gas, etc.  She says that she has 4 children but they are all married.  She adds "my children can only help me a little because they also have their families to support. Their help does, however, help me to buy my medication and pay my utility bills".

As she lives close to a high school, a kindergarten and a middle school, she set up her sweet stall outside her house just over a year ago, she says.  The children from these schools have become her customers as she also sells soft drinks and fruit juices.  This business allows her to help herself and to feel useful since, being visually impaired, she cannot go out and look for work or go out in the street alone.  She says that someone who is a great help to her is one of her daughters-in-law who helps her to stock up on sweets in local shops, where she finds low prices and can make some money.  She says that this is the second time that she has worked with VisionFund and that it has gone well. She does not feel weighed down by the repayments since she can use her earnings from selling sweets to pay off the loan and continue stocking her stall.  

She is now applying for another loan so that she can obtain supplies of sweets of different kinds and flavours and soft drinks.  Her goal is to expand her business and next year she wants to sell pencils, crayons, note books of different sizes, rubbers and pencil-sharpeners as a means of improving her quality of life.  The other members of the group are called Silvia, Martha, Griselda, Laura Angélica, Argelia, Susana, Karen Alejandra, Karen Alejandra and Estela.  They will use the loan to purchase supplies for a stationery shop, ingredients for the preparation of healthy creams to sell, supplies of ladies' underwear and ladies', men's and children's clothing for retail.   They will also invest in equipment for an internet café, and will buy in bulk soft drinks to stock up a warehouse and sell wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sweets of different flavours, soft drinks, fruit juices, etc to sell.

loans.name: Mirasoles De Toxico Group

texts.es:
El grupo está integrado por cuatro mujeres muy trabajadoras que han decidido solicitar un crédito para invertir en sus actividades productivas.
El grupo se encuentra en una comunidad muy bonita pero el transporte es muy escaso, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque el día que estaban por levantarles solicitudes para su crédito se les ocurrió porque una de las integrantes se encontraba cortando estas flores.
Matilde la representante del grupo platica que tiene 27 años de edad está casada con el señor Cesar desde hace varios años juntos han formado una familia con tres niños de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando. Esta vez Maty, como mejor la conocen, está solicitando crédito para comprar ingredientes para sus antojitos mexicanos como elotes, pan, pollo, longaniza que es con lo que frecuentemente se le termina más rápido sus antojitos mexicanos que vende son  pambazos, elotes, esquites, maruchas, quesadillas, café, té, sincronizadas, papas fritas y la actividad la inicio hace tres años y la inicio porque siempre cuando su familia quería algún antojito mexicano tenían que ir hasta el centro y fue como su familia la motivo para iniciar a vender estas delicias. Maty cuenta que le va muy bien en su actividad es por eso que  esta muy contenta por sus grandes beneficios que le ha traído a su familia, aunque su única dificultad que presenta hasta el momento es la falta de un  local más grande en donde pueda vender sus productos bien ya que por el momento solo vende en su adentro de su casa y para ella si es molesto estar atendiendo en este espacio tan personal, también le hace falta una muy buena parrilla especial para hacer las papas fritas. Aunque su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan terminar una carrera profesional donde puedan realizarse y puedan tener una vida más estable. Las integrantes del grupo son Reyna quien invertirá en pollos, Laura invertirá en venta de perfumes y Lucía en la venta de productos de plástico para el hogar.
texts.en:
This group consists of four very hardworking women who have decided to request a loan to invest in their productive activities.  The group is from a very pretty community but transportation is scarce.  They chose the name of the group because on the day they were going to fill out their loan applications one of the members was cutting that kind of flower.

Matilde is the group representative.  She’s 27-years-old and married to Cesar for many years.  They have formed a family with three children two of which are attending school.  This time Maty, as she’s better known, is asking for the loan to buy ingredients like corn, bread, chicken and sausage for her Mexican fast-food snacks; they are the ingredients that run out most quickly.  Some of the Mexican fast-food snacks she sells are: ‘pambazos’ [chorizo, potatoes, lettuce and string cheese dipped in a spicy guajillo pepper sauce and then grilled], ‘elotes’ [corn on the cob], ‘esquites’ [popped corn], ‘maruchas’ [instant noodle soup], ‘quesadillas’ [cheese-filled tortilla], coffee, tea, ‘sincronizadas’ [grilled ham and cheese sandwich], and fried potatoes.  She started the business three years ago and did so because whenever her family wanted a Mexican fast-food snack they’d have to go downtown and this is how her family motivated her to start selling these delights.

Maty relates that she does very well in her activity so she’s very happy with the great benefits it’s brought her family although the only difficulty she faces to date is the lack of a larger space in which to sell her products; for the moment, she sells from inside her house and for her it’s a bother to tend to customers in such a personal space.  She also needs a good, special griddle for making the fried potatoes.  Her greatest dream, however, is that her children complete professional careers so they can be fulfilled and have a more stable life.

The other group members are Reyna who will invest in chickens, Laura who will invest in perfume sales and Lucía in the sale of plastic items for the home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make Mexican fast-food snacks.

loans.name: Renovación Group

texts.es: El Grupo Renovación se encuentra ubicado en una comunidad hermosa y muy grande que también se caracteriza por tener vecinos muy responsables y respetuosos, el grupo está integrado por ocho mujeres y dos hombres ellos mismos eligieron el nombre del grupo y surgió porque anteriormente pertenecían a otro grupo que llevaba por nombre Granada pero para ellos,  separarse fue como iniciar nuevamente por eso le pusieron así “Renovación” la representante del grupo es Herlinda quien tiene 55 años de edad esta casada con el señor Salomón tuvieron una familia con hijos solo que ahora en la actualidad ya no tiene dependientes la señora Herlinda se dedica a la crianza y engorda de pollos para después venderlos, esta vez esta solicitando el crédito a la institución para comprar 50 pollos y 20 conejos, Doña Herlinda platica que desde hace 25 años inicio con su actividad Doña Herlinda platica “Inicie mi actividad porque quería ayudarle a mi esposo con los gastos del hogar y con la educación de mis hijos ya que cuando mi esposo se quedaba sin trabajo podía yo vender uno de mis pollos y así salir de apuro económico lo que mas me emociona de criar los pollos es verlos cuando andan todos juntos y chicos” mi única dificultad para criar mis pollos es la falta de un buen coral para que a sus pollos no les pegue el frio y enfermen ya que cuando enferman pueden llegar a morir lo implicaría una pérdida de ganancia para Doña Herlinda. A pesar de estas dificultades, ella no se desanima y aun asi su meta es llegar a tener unas buenas galeras para tener a sus pollos bien calientitos y evitar que se enfermen. Las integrantes del grupo son Doña Gregoria, Clara quienes invertirán en su tienda de abarrotes, Rosario comprara zapatos para su venta, Albina, Ángel y Benita quienes compraran borregos para cria y venta, Carlos quien comprara becerros, Rafaela quien invertirá en sus estambres, finalmente Carmen quien invertirá en sus cerdos. Ellas conforman el grupo Renovación son personas muy responsables sus gran entusiastas  por querer lograr sus sueños es lo que los ha impulsado ha iniciar con sus actividades.
texts.en:
The “Renovación” (Renewal) group is located in a beautiful, very large community noted for having very responsible, respectful residents.  The group consists of eight women and two men who chose the group name themselves and arose because they used to belong to another group that was called “Granada” but for them separating from it was like starting anew which is why they called it “Renovación.”

The group representative is Herlinda, 55, who’s married to Salomón.  They formed a family with children but as of now she no longer has any dependents.  Herlinda works raising and fattening up chicks for subsequent sale and on this occasion is requesting the loan from the institution to buy 50 chicks and 20 rabbits.  Herlinda relates that she started her activity 25 years ago.  She relates: “I started my activity because I wanted to help my husband with household expenses and with my children’s schooling because whenever my husband was without work I could sell one of my chickens and get through an economic tight spot; what I like best is raising the chickens and watch them when they are little and they move around together; my only difficulty to raise them is the lack of a good corral so that they won’t be affected by the cold and get sick because when they get sick they can die and that implies a loss of profits.”  Despite these difficulties, she does not become discouraged and her goal is still to have some good sheds to keep her chicks nice and warm to avoid illnesses.  

The other group members are Gregoria and Clara who will invest in their grocery stores, Rosario who will buy shoes to sell, Albina, Ángel and Benita who will buy sheep to raise and then sell, Carlos who will buy calves, Rafaela who will buy yarn and finally Carmen who will invest in pigs.  They make up the “Renovación” group and are very responsible people who are very enthusiastic about reaching their dreams which is what has propelled them into starting their activities.

loans.use: to buy 50 chicks and 20 rabbits.

location.town: Dolores Hidalgo, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Jorge Adalberto

texts.es:
Jorge, quiere invertir en la compra de un vehículo para trabajar con él, pero tiene que repararlo en algunos apectos esteticos (tapizado), esta es su manera de trabajar haciendo negocio con vehículos en mal estado, los repara, los usa para el negocio  y los vende en buenas condiciones, a parte de tener el negocio de las sandias, El proposito de este préstamo es completar el valor del vehiculo y comprara algunos materiales que sean necesarios para arreglarlo.
Considera que su inversión con prestamos anteriores le han dado al negocio movimiento, ha estado negociando vehículos y vendiendo,en temporada de sandia las compra para comercializarlas, estos créditos le permiten tener una fuente de empleo y de ingresos.
texts.en:
Jorge wants to invest in the purchase of a vehicle to work on and repair some aesthetic aspects (upholstery), since this is how he works: buying vehicles in poor condition, repairing them, using them for another watermelon business and then selling them in good condition. He also has a watermelon business. With this loan he will have the enough money and will buy some parts that will be necessary to fix and sell the vehicle.  

He believes that his investments from previous loans have put his business in motion. He has been negotiating for vehicles and selling them. In watermelon season, he buys watermelons in order to sell them.  These loans allow him to have a source of employment and income.

loans.use: Completar el valor de un vehiculo.

loans.name: Rosa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rosa, necesita un crédito para invertirlo en la temporada de finales de Noviembre y Diciembre realizando tamales, para esto deberá comprase maíz, hojas de banano, pollo, condimentos, aceite, entre otros productos que sean necesarios para realizar la venta.
Con el préstamo anterior tuvo un efecto positivo, ayudo a mejorar el negocio, tambien cubrió algunos gastos en medicinas para su hijo menor, su esposo actualmente cuenta con trabajo ya son dos aportes para el hogar.
texts.en: Rosa needs a loan to take advantage of the holiday season in November and December, making tamales. For this, she will have to buy corn, banana leaves, chicken, seasonings, oil among other products that are needed in order to sell tamales. Her previous loan had a positive effect; it helped her improve her business, as well as pay for some medical expenses for her youngest son. Her husband currently works, so both of them contribute to the household.

loans.use: to purchase corn, banana leaves, chicken, seasonings and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vitamins, in pill and liquid form, such as iodized radish and raw liver.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Cesar Danilo

texts.es: Cesar de 20 años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus padres, es un joven muy trabajador, su mayor sueño es trabajar duro para brindarle lo mejor a su familia, es honesto, responsable y emprendedor con sus labores diarias. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado poco a poco sembrar un terreno con loroco, que es un cultivo que tradicionalmente gusta mucho en el país y extranjero, este es usado para acompañar comidas caseras y también platillos típicos como las deliciosas pupusas. Lo que cosecha lo vende al por mayor en mercados regionales, cuenta con mucha clientela y a finales de éste año desea darle mantenimiento al mismo cultivo, robusteciendolo con fertilizantes y tratando que éste próximo año la cosecha sea mas grande y así pueda generar mayores ingresos para el bienestar de su familia, por ésto solicita a INTEGRAL préstamo con el que pueda comprar fertilizantes y controles de plaga para la defensa del loroco.
texts.en: Cesar is 20 years of age and lives together with his wife and his parents. He is a very hard-working youth whose main dream is to work hard to afford the best for his family. He is honest, responsible and enterprising with his daily work. With effort and dedication he succeeded little by little planting loroco (a Central American produce), which is a traditional plant enjoyed by Salvadorans and travelers.  Locoro is used to accompany homemade foods and typical dishes such as delicious pupusas.  What he harvests he sells for a good price in the regional markets.  He has many clients, and at the end of the year he hopes to provide maintenance to his crop making them stronger with fertilizer and making next years harvest larger so he can earn more income to provide for the well-being of his family.  This is why he is requesting this loan from Integral to buy fertilizers and insecticides to protect his locoro.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides to protect his locoro crop.

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es:
Rosa con 54 años de edad, casado, madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante. Ella cuenta que empezó a vender cajeta (dulce típicos) hace 30 años y con el dinero que iba ahorrando poco a poco, decidió poner su propio de negocio de venta de zapatos y ropa del que es propietaria hace 3 años, ya que ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus 2 hijas, de esta manera a ella le gustaría  ampliar mas su negocio para incrementar sus ventas. 
Ella solicita este crédito para comprar mercadería en general como pantalones, blusas, faldas, sandalias, etc.  Ya que este crédito le ayudara porque podrá incrementar la demanda de productos que la clientela ha venido solicitando, como planes futuros desea lograr dejar bien establecido el negocio, sus metas próximas es llegar a remodelar el local para establecer una tienda más grande de ropa y zapatos, con la ganancia que le genere su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa, 54, is married and mother of five adult children; her occupation is merchant.  She started out selling ‘cajeta’ (traditional sweet) 30 years ago and with the money she saved up gradually decided to open her own business selling shoes and clothes which she’s now owned for the last three years.  Her two daughters help out.  She’d like to expand the business more to increase sales.

She requests the loan to buy general merchandise like pants, blouses, skirts, sandals, etc. This loan will help her because she’ll be able to increase demand of products customers have been requesting.  Her future plan is to leave the business well-established.  Her short-term goal is to remodel the space to establish a larger clothing and shoe store with the profits her business generates.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, sandals, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for her pharmacy.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is married with five children. She is 38 years old and lives in Bintana, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Jocelyn sells banana fruits to earn a living and has had this business for three years. Each month, she earns PHP 7,000 doing this type of work. 

Jocelyn has requested a loan of PHP 14,000 to finance the purchase of bananas for her retail business. Jocelyn became a member of PMPC this year.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her living conditions by using the profits of the business.

loans.use: to finance her banana sales business

loans.name: Nodira

texts.ru:
Молодая и энергичная женщина из севера Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Нодира. Она студентка и недавно вышла замуж. После замужества она осознала, что она должна заработать деньги, так как дом мужа ей не родительский дом и ее никто не балует и обеспечивает, как это делал ее отец. Нодира посоветовалась с мужем и решила организовать свой бизнес. Бизнес она вполне может совмещать с учебой, так как она учится в заочное отделение. 
С целью организовать свой бизнес, она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей мужской одежды. Ее муж будет помогать ей в ведении бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует оплатить за учебу, а также купить все не обходимые вещи для себя и семьи. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 8000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Nodira, a young and dynamic woman from northern Tajikistan, needs your support.  

Nodira is a student and she recently got married.  After her wedding, she realized that she should be earning some money, as she no longer lives in the house she grew up in but in her husband's house where no one cares and provides for her the way her father used to.  After consulting with her husband, Nodira decided to start her own business.  Combining work and study will not be a problem since she is pursuing her studies through a correspondence class.

In order to start her new business, Nodira enrolled in a course entitled "Achieving success", organized by the Association of Business Women, and she has earned a certificate.  She can now start her business for good and become a successful entrepreneur.  She wants to get involved in buying and selling men's clothing, and her husband will be helping her with this new business.  Nodira plans to use her income to pay for her studies and also to buy all the necessary items for herself and her family. 

She is requesting a loan of  8,000 somoni to buy some goods to start her new business and she is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy clothes to start a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Tareq

texts.en:
Tareq is a 32-year-old man from Gaza. He is married with two boys and a girl.
He has owned a small grocery store since 2009 and is now asking Ryada for a loan in order to buy a display refrigerator and more goods for the store.
Tareq hopes that this loan will help him get more customers and improve his income to help provide his family with a better future and education.

loans.use: to buy a display refrigerator and more goods for the store.

loans.name: Mazen

texts.en:
Mazen is a 37-year-old married man. He lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in the Gaza strip with his wife and six children who are all under 18 years old. For the past two years, Mazen has had a store selling electrical products and spare parts This business has been profitable and the only source of income for the family. The store needs more support from time to time to cover the cost. 

Mazen needs more money to buy more stock to improve his business and raise his income. Mazen took a USD loan from FATEN to buy more electrical goods for his store. This will increase sales and improve the family's income.

Mazen is photographed inside his store.

loans.use: To buy electrical goods to sell.

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en:
Thuraya is a 54-year-old married woman. She lives in a small house in the Jabalila refugee camp in the Gaza Strip with her husband and two daughters. Thuraya's husband is a construction worker with a low income that cannot cover all their needs. Thuraya and her family would like to buy new living room furniture. 
Thuraya requested a USD loan from FATEN to buy living room furniture for her house. This will improve the family's living conditions and enable Thuraya and her family to enjoy living in their house.
Thuraya and her husband Saleem appear in the picture.

loans.use: To buy new living room furniture.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 44-year-old married man with two sons and two daughters.

For the past four years, he has been driving a taxi which has been a profitable job and the only source of income for his family. His business needs more support from time to time.

Adel is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for his taxi. This will increase the taxi's capacity to run for more hours and enable Adel to take additional customer requests which will improve the family's income.

Adel is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to purchase new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is an ambitious 27-year-old single man who has his own business raising and selling horses. This business is considered a new and profitable one but needs capital to grow. 

Ahmad is requesting a USD youth loan from FATEN to buy more horses for his farm. This will increase sales and improve Ahmad's income which will help his prospects for the future.

Ahmad appears in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more horses to sell.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is a Ghanaian artisan who makes jewelry out of natural materials such as bone and horn. He would like to buy a drilling machine for his workshop, and stock up on the materials he uses for his designs.

Collins has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"I was born into a family of artists and my father taught me to make jewelry using natural materials such as bone and horn. Right out of school, I joined the family workshop and worked with my father for eight years. I set up my own workshop when I married. I craft each bead by hand and use them in necklaces and bracelets. Although I now work independently, I still visit my Dad’s shop to share ideas on the trade and new techniques. I currently have a staff of two and have trained over six people who have moved on to establish their own workshops."

"I want to thank all of you who help fund this micro-credit. I believe it will go a long way to help me produce more jewelry."

Use the link below to view Collins's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8725

loans.use: to buy a drilling machine for his workshop, and also to stock up on the materials he uses for his designs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Analyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from raising pigs. Analyn is borrowing 26000 PHP through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula and her family are dedicated to farming without agrochemical fertilizers and are already composting and vermicomposting. They are acquiring a six cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester to process the waste from their dairy cows into potent organic fertilizer (biol) which they will use on their maize and alfalfa. Moreover, they will use the renewable biogas produced by the system to reduce their LP gas use. This loan represents 50% of the total price of their Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Narcesta

texts.en:
Narcesta is 40 years old and single.

She earns a living by buying and selling dried coconut in the Philippines. Narcesta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase more dried coconut to sell.

Narcesta has been buying and selling dried coconut for six years and also earns additional income from working in a general store and farming coconut.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried coconut to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling seafood in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional seafood to sell.

Carmelita has been in this business for 23 years. She earns additional income from selling dried coconut meat.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seafood to sell.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.ru:
Муяссару 23 года. Она замужем, но еще не имеет детей. С детства она любила печь пироги и когда она вышла замуж, семья ее мужа была в восторге от вкусных тортов и пирогов, которые пекла Муяссар. Ее свекровь посоветовала ей печь и продавать торты и пироги и таким образом зарабатывать деньги, так как муж Муяссара еще не в состоянии содержать семью. Муяссару и ее мужу очень понравилась это идея. Итак, Муяссар решила организовать свой бизнес. 
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она будет печь дома кондитерские изделия, а ее муж будет помогать ей для продажи. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условия проживания и создать свой материнский капитал для своих будущих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки духовки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
